deleteRecursive

public static boolean deleteRecursive(java.io.File path)
                               throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Deletes a directory By default File#delete fails for non-empty directories, it works like "rm". We need something a little more brutual - this does the equivalent of "rm -r"

Parameters:
path - Root File Path
Returns:
true iff the file and all sub files/directories have been removed
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
